description: Creates a MatchingWorkflow object which stores the configuration of the data processing job to be run. It is important to note that there should not be a pre-existing MatchingWorkflow with the same name. To modify an existing workflow, utilize the UpdateMatchingWorkflow API.

parameters.name: workflowName
parameters.description: The name of the workflow. There can't be multiple MatchingWorkflows with the same name.

parameters.name: inputSourceConfig
parameters.description: A list of InputSource objects, which have the fields InputSourceARN and SchemaName. (dict) --- An object containing InputSourceARN, SchemaName, and ApplyNormalization. An Glue table Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the input source table. The name of the schema to be retrieved. applyNormalization (boolean) --- Normalizes the attributes defined in the schema in the input data. For example, if an attribute has an AttributeType of PHONE_NUMBER, and the data in the input table is in a format of 1234567890, Entity Resolution will normalize this field in the output to (123)-456-7890.

nested_params.name: inputSourceARN
nested_params.description: An Glue table Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the input source table.

nested_params.name: schemaName
nested_params.description: The name of the schema to be retrieved.

nested_params.name: applyNormalization
nested_params.description: Normalizes the attributes defined in the schema in the input data. For example, if an attribute has an AttributeType of PHONE_NUMBER, and the data in the input table is in a format of 1234567890, Entity Resolution will normalize this field in the output to (123)-456-7890.

parameters.name: outputSourceConfig
parameters.description: A list of OutputSource objects, each of which contains fields OutputS3Path, ApplyNormalization, and Output. (dict) --- A list of OutputAttribute objects, each of which have the fields Name and Hashed. Each of these objects selects a column to be included in the output table, and whether the values of the column should be hashed. The S3 path to which Entity Resolution will write the output table. KMSArn (string) --- Customer KMS ARN for encryption at rest. If not provided, system will use an Entity Resolution managed KMS key. A list of OutputAttribute objects, each of which have the fields Name and Hashed. A name of a column to be written to the output. This must be an InputField name in the schema mapping. hashed (boolean) --- Enables the ability to hash the column values in the output. applyNormalization (boolean) --- Normalizes the attributes defined in the schema in the input data. For example, if an attribute has an AttributeType of PHONE_NUMBER, and the data in the input table is in a format of 1234567890, Entity Resolution will normalize this field in the output to (123)-456-7890.

nested_params.name: outputS3Path
nested_params.description: The S3 path to which Entity Resolution will write the output table.

nested_params.name: KMSArn
nested_params.description: Customer KMS ARN for encryption at rest. If not provided, system will use an Entity Resolution managed KMS key.

nested_params.name: output
nested_params.description: A list of OutputAttribute objects, each of which have the fields Name and Hashed. Each of these objects selects a column to be included in the output table, and whether the values of the column should be hashed.

nested_params.name: name
nested_params.description: A name of a column to be written to the output. This must be an InputField name in the schema mapping.

nested_params.name: hashed
nested_params.description: Enables the ability to hash the column values in the output.

nested_params.name: applyNormalization
nested_params.description: Normalizes the attributes defined in the schema in the input data. For example, if an attribute has an AttributeType of PHONE_NUMBER, and the data in the input table is in a format of 1234567890, Entity Resolution will normalize this field in the output to (123)-456-7890.

parameters.name: resolutionTechniques
parameters.description: An object which defines the resolutionType and the ruleBasedProperties. The type of matching. There are three types of matching: RULE_MATCHING, ML_MATCHING, and PROVIDER. ruleBasedProperties (dict) --- An object which defines the list of matching rules to run and has a field Rules, which is a list of rule objects. A list of Rule objects, each of which have fields RuleName and MatchingKeys. (dict) --- An object containing RuleName, and MatchingKeys. A name for the matching rule. A list of MatchingKeys. The MatchingKeys must have been defined in the SchemaMapping. Two records are considered to match according to this rule if all of the MatchingKeys match. (string) --- The comparison type. You can either choose ONE_TO_ONE or MANY_TO_MANY as the attributeMatchingModel. If you choose MANY_TO_MANY, the system can match attributes across the sub-types of an attribute type. For example, if the value of the Email field of Profile A and the value of BusinessEmail field of Profile B matches, the two profiles are matched on the Email attribute type. If you choose ONE_TO_ONE, the system can only match attributes if the sub-types are an exact match. For example, for the Email attribute type, the system will only consider it a match if the value of the Email field of Profile A matches the value of the Email field of Profile B. matchPurpose (string) --- An indicator of whether to generate IDs and index the data or not. If you choose IDENTIFIER_GENERATION, the process generates IDs and indexes the data. If you choose INDEXING, the process indexes the data without generating IDs. providerProperties (dict) --- The properties of the provider service. The ARN of the provider service. providerConfiguration (document) --- The required configuration fields to use with the provider service. intermediateSourceConfiguration (dict) --- The Amazon S3 location that temporarily stores your data while it processes. Your information won't be saved permanently. The Amazon S3 location (bucket and prefix). For example: s3://provider_bucket/DOC-EXAMPLE-BUCKET.

nested_params.name: resolutionType
nested_params.description: The type of matching. There are three types of matching: RULE_MATCHING, ML_MATCHING, and PROVIDER.

nested_params.name: ruleBasedProperties
nested_params.description: An object which defines the list of matching rules to run and has a field Rules, which is a list of rule objects.

nested_params.name: rules
nested_params.description: A list of Rule objects, each of which have fields RuleName and MatchingKeys.

nested_params.name: ruleName
nested_params.description: A name for the matching rule.

nested_params.name: matchingKeys
nested_params.description: A list of MatchingKeys. The MatchingKeys must have been defined in the SchemaMapping. Two records are considered to match according to this rule if all of the MatchingKeys match.

nested_params.name: attributeMatchingModel
nested_params.description: The comparison type. You can either choose ONE_TO_ONE or MANY_TO_MANY as the attributeMatchingModel. If you choose MANY_TO_MANY, the system can match attributes across the sub-types of an attribute type. For example, if the value of the Email field of Profile A and the value of BusinessEmail field of Profile B matches, the two profiles are matched on the Email attribute type. If you choose ONE_TO_ONE, the system can only match attributes if the sub-types are an exact match. For example, for the Email attribute type, the system will only consider it a match if the value of the Email field of Profile A matches the value of the Email field of Profile B.

nested_params.name: matchPurpose
nested_params.description: An indicator of whether to generate IDs and index the data or not. If you choose IDENTIFIER_GENERATION, the process generates IDs and indexes the data. If you choose INDEXING, the process indexes the data without generating IDs.

nested_params.name: providerProperties
nested_params.description: The properties of the provider service.

nested_params.name: providerServiceArn
nested_params.description: The ARN of the provider service.

nested_params.name: providerConfiguration
nested_params.description: The required configuration fields to use with the provider service.

nested_params.name: intermediateSourceConfiguration
nested_params.description: The Amazon S3 location that temporarily stores your data while it processes. Your information won't be saved permanently.

nested_params.name: intermediateS3Path
nested_params.description: The Amazon S3 location (bucket and prefix). For example: s3://provider_bucket/DOC-EXAMPLE-BUCKET.

parameters.name: incrementalRunConfig
parameters.description: An object which defines an incremental run type and has only incrementalRunType as a field. incrementalRunType (string) --- The type of incremental run. It takes only one value: IMMEDIATE.

nested_params.name: incrementalRunType
nested_params.description: The type of incremental run. It takes only one value: IMMEDIATE.

parameters.name: roleArn
parameters.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM role. Entity Resolution assumes this role to create resources on your behalf as part of workflow execution.

parameters.name: tags
parameters.description: The tags used to organize, track, or control access for this resource. (string) --- (string) ---
